website_summaries.verdict: A step up for a home brewing refractometer that is accurate enough to replace a hydrometer without fail.
pros: Device only requires a few drops to get accurate readings to measure the consistency of the brew
Automatic temperature compensation makes it easy to take a reading from cold beverages
cons: Refractometer will require proper calibration from time to time if used for consistent home brewing

customer_reviews.title: Not for wine makers
customer_reviews.text: If you make wine and your SG is routinely below 1.0, this is not the right refractometer. The built in scale only goes to 1.0. It appears to be that if the SG is below 1.0, it reads 1.024 regardless. It's great for beer or taking the OG. I really like it, but still need my hydrometer after primary ferment.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: So much less waste now!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more happy with this purchase! This arrived promptly and in great condition. It's accurate and has everything you need to get started. The scales are clear and easy to read thanks to being able to focus the viewing lens. I've included shots of the readings for my batch of mead I started with this refractometer and my hydrometer for comparison. If you're tired of wasting significant quantities of wort/must for hydrometer readings you need this refractometer! ***Just like all refractometers you'll need to use an online calculator to calculate the accurate state of your brew once fermentation gets going.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Williams

customer_reviews.title: A must for every Home Brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect as far as I am concerned. Needed no calibration out of the box (water showed 1.000 SG) though there is a calibration screw and mini flathead driver included if it does need adjustment) crystal clear viewing with adjustable focus. Very happy with purchase and a major upgrade from basic hydrometer. Also need to mention that this has automated adjustment for temperature variation. A+ And in case you're curious, in the pictures I'm comparing tap water to "The Amigo" Mexican lager that I just started lagering.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin J. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Tool came well packaged in a plastic storage box with all needed accessories including a refractometer, dropped, a screwdriver, a user manual and a cleaning cloth! It seems well made, is a pleasure to use, is accurate and the eyepiece is focusable so you can easily read the scales. I highly recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.author: MegWing8

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: Comparing a known chemical to an unknown showed identity for refractive index and de-ionized water read exactly zero on the scale. At least for those parameters, and the very reasonable price, this refractometer is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: MICROBIOBOB

customer_reviews.title: Much much easier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to measure the gravity of my wort/beer for home brew. I must say this is so much easier than using a hydrometer and uses so much less liquid. I believe every home brewer should have one of these.
customer_reviews.author: JacksonJames

customer_reviews.title: I can see the light child
customer_reviews.text: The Brix Refractometer in came on time and works as described. It takes the guess work out of my OG and FG readings. My hydrometer worked for years, but I was using too much wort in the end. This is a simple eyelet drop or two, and the numbers don't lie. I would buy from this seller again. Great product for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: FlopFilm

customer_reviews.title: Welcomed addition to my homebrewing arsenal.
customer_reviews.text: I checked calibration with distilled water, it was spot on. I did an extract brew and found that this refractometer matched the pre and post boil gravities as Beersmith listed them. I'm now confident in the accuracy of this device. I can't wait to do an all-grain brew with this so that I can hit my marks.
customer_reviews.author: B. CAREY

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as coming with a prism block and optical calibration liquid. They are not included, and the instructions provided are for calibrating a saline refractometer, not sugar solutions like honey or jam.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sacerdote

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: It comes in a nice little box, it’s a solid unit and easy to calibrate. The instructions are worthless as others have said, and it doesn’t include ‘calibration fluid’ but a web/YouTube search shows people using olive oil for that. It works great and it’s good to know that the honey I’m giving to family and friends has a safe moisture level
customer_reviews.author: Master Tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works great, but you MUST calibrate it before you use it. (Hint, use extra virgin olive oil as a calibration oil (71.5 brix). Initially, I had a hard time focusing it, until I realized that the rubber cover was turning , but not the focusing ring! This is a must for determining if your honey is ready for extraction
customer_reviews.author: aaviator

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had Bought This Sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: As an amateur mead and wine maker, I found this to be a solution to a problem I never knew I had. I bought this after my traditional specific gravity meter broke. It's easy to use, easy to calibrate, and only takes a small eyedropper's-worth of liquid to measure as opposed to a full graduated cylinder. It was well worth paying a little more than I would for a traditional meter.
customer_reviews.author: Mixed

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: A simple and easy to use Brix meter! I re-calibrated the meter to extra virgin olive oil to 71-71.5% Brix and it works great! the eye-piece is a bit small and can be hard to read, but to solve that problem, just hold it up to your cellphone camera and take a picture, now you have a record of the reading and can see it better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to measure alcohol content of kombucha - was able to take the readings from this unit and input into a website to get ABV, very cool. This refractometer is well constructed, though the case is not so much as it broke the second time I opened it. Overall would definitely purchase again especially at this price point
customer_reviews.author: M. McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive time/hassle saver
customer_reviews.text: Works good, seems well built, calibration was right on out of the box. Saves so much time vs my hydrometer, well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Doerr

customer_reviews.title: For salt system pools or spas too!
customer_reviews.text: Actually the instrument works great but the way I use it makes it a little hard to read because I'm reading 3,000 ppm with a salt hot tub and it converts to 3 on the scale. Salt test strips for pool/spa cost about $1.50 each so the instrument is a much cheaper way to test the water. I zeroed the instrument and after compared the salt strip to it and both gave the same reading!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Said 63 percent so I bought some 50/50 antifreeze. It tested at 65 percent. I calibrated it and still the same. Sadly I waited till it was warm to do all of this and the return window is gone.
customer_reviews.author: cellman2424

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to calibrate and use.
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use for water kefir and kombucha. Case closure stopped working after a few uses. Now using a hair elestic.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Walshe

customer_reviews.title: The calibration instructions are AFU
customer_reviews.text: The instructions and equipment provided for calibrating this device are faulty. Calibration instructions suggest using distilled water to calibrate but distilled water values or outside the range of the displayed scale. Hey Google search says you need dioptric oil and a reference block to calibrate this accurately for honey but they are not included in the kit. Now I got to go find some dioptric oil and a reference block. Oh by the way, it’s made in China
customer_reviews.author: fishi

customer_reviews.title: Great brix refractometer!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described, very simple to use, I should have gotten one of these when I first started brewing! Solid construction, feels very durable. Arrived perfectly calibrated.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Burk

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Quality control on this product is not very good. First one I received had a cracked viewing window. Got a replacement and it was also cracked. Spend the money elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Realistic Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: buy a different one
customer_reviews.text: buy a different one. this one sucks. can barley read it. after buying a real one from home brew store. i noticed how crappy this one really was.
customer_reviews.author: Code

customer_reviews.title: How to calibrate?
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to calibrate but I don't have the scale to take to 0.I understand the reference picture in booklet is different but it would be nice if I had reference for the scales I do have. The 3 scales are BRIX 90-58, Water %12-27, 20 degree C BE 43-28 Any help on how to calibrate would be most appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower2499

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for OG reading. Need to use calculator for conversion to determine FG and ABV in finished product but it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Spokedoke

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, expensive paper weight.
customer_reviews.text: Came with what looked like dried super glue on prism, it will not come off. All rubber parts have an odd haze on them. Calibrated with distilled water, reads .010 +/- .002 off, rendering it junk.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Garage
customer_reviews.text: After calibration an temperature equalization the unit was not accurate. It is not accurate enough to recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jrbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of them, one for myself and one is a gift. One of which, turned out to have a scratch on the glass that effects visibility of the chart in some areas. Other than that, they seem to be fine and a good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: If you've been wondering about it I think you'll be satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My first time using this product. Works great. I wear glasses but I can read the numbers perfectly without them. Much more accurate than the old plastic type I used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hogan

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Instructions were somewhat confusing, but I understood them eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Larsson

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: The refractometer is easy to use and very accurate. I have to say that after standardizing the unit with distilled water I have used the meter only once. However, in my last wort I checked it against a hydrometer and they both gave the same reading. That was good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this to check the brix levels of my plants. It lets me know how healthy my plants are. Works great
customer_reviews.author: k. pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Used this to test the HomeBrew I was making. Compared against an Hydrometer and the measurements were the same. This is easy to use and uses much less beer in the testing. Make sure you face it toward bright light and the measurements are easy to see and read.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive device makes checking gravity so munch easier and needs only a drop of beer. By far one of the best tools in the brew box.
customer_reviews.author: mgaron

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this for real ginger beer brewing, from a ginger beer plant. It gives me some idea of the alcohol content, but more importantly provides a way to get some consistency between batches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and nifty little tool
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived exactly as specified in the listing and worked perfectly. instructions were clear and simple to read. A terrific experience.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick E Moreno

customer_reviews.title: good for price
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Good for testing the progress of my wine.
customer_reviews.author: REB

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how easy this is to,use! Real happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for honey moisture content
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for honey moisture calculation. Easy to read if you have access to bright light. Very good price
customer_reviews.author: MR H

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy for the money. It seems to read higher by a point or two when I'm measuring the gravity of my wort in comparison to my hydrometer, but it has given the same consistent result so I know I can count on that
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Tyson

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used it much yet, seems to work ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much yet,seems to work ok.The eye piece feels loose by the time it is in focus.seems to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home brewers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, clear instructions and good value for the money. Definitely glad I made this purchase. Makes taking gravity readings so much easier for my Mead brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, read, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I tested it by getting a hydrometer reading at the same time and got the same reading.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, and I have no reason to doubt its accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Diego3Ke

customer_reviews.title: nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: used to check my wort, showed my % and was easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calibration problems
customer_reviews.text: The instrument itself is good. Had some trouble with calibration though, because the instructions that came with it weren't correct. Ended up going to Google to get it calibrated correctly. That's the reason I couldn't give it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Vanhoose

customer_reviews.title: very fast reading with minimum volume needed
customer_reviews.text: very handy device that can be taken to the field for measurement. only needs few drops to take measurement in both brix % and SG.
customer_reviews.author: Elie Haber

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Did calibration with distilled water at 68deg Checked FG on wort came in at 1.024. Double checked with my hydrometer (which I've owned for over ten years) and it came in at 1.010. Tasted and the hydrometer is correct disappointed with this purchase. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: john piazza

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Use for brewing. Works as it is supposed to without issues.
customer_reviews.author: A Radbill

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This product is excatly what I expected. It is great for measuring the gravity in my wort without wasting a lot. Comes with two tools to take samples and a tool to calibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Easy read.
customer_reviews.text: Quick ship, easy read, expect high accuracy. Will perform initial comparison with hydrometer soon. Heavy homebrew coming soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Antifreeze protection
customer_reviews.text: very professional and well made tool. used it to be sure my boat engine wasn't going to free stored outside during harsh winter temperatures
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is bc the box it came in was broken and in pieces.
customer_reviews.author: francisco b.

customer_reviews.title: If you want accuracy stick to your hydrometer or get a good one. These are all junk.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Decently accurate, not enough for its intended purpose tho. Quality is very poor, the lenses went completely off track. Should have stuck to buy once, cry once.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and highly accurate! Mine was perfectly calibrated. I like that it comes in a nice box with pipets, cloth and screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: George O.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great accuracy, easy to use, and low price!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for saltwater aquariums and it is very easy to use and very accurate. I was surprised at the high quality given the low price!
customer_reviews.author: Navanax Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Instrument, Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for simple plant testing. Great to have the information immediately. Will be using the Brix Refractometer to do field testing plants in regenerative agriculture consulting.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: great product, works exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: This has become a great addition to my home brewing kit, letting me monitor brix during mash, mash out, and into the kettle. A must have
customer_reviews.author: Matt from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Honey refractometer
customer_reviews.text: Honey refractometer comes already calibrated. Checked this season's honey, easy to read and eliminates guessing if your honey is at the right moisture content. Good price also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brix Refractometer-great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Very easy to use and read. Seller shipped it right away and I received it very quickly. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly as I expected. It is so much easier than using a hydrometer. I wish I bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This unit is of much higher quality than I expected. It is an excellent value and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey N.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Make sure you have distilled water for calibration.
customer_reviews.author: Hazmat Hauler

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for checking cnc cutting fluid levels in or machine shop.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin A Russo

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included with device
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions for use included with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have s.g and brix right next to each other. I found it to be a bit off but not really enough to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calibrate before using
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time Good price Works really good for water content in honey
customer_reviews.author: Rene Jucker

customer_reviews.title: tool
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband and it was exactly what he needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: didnt receive all of it
customer_reviews.text: didnt receive the block and oil otherwise the rest of it seemed to be in good shape
customer_reviews.author: leroy clark

customer_reviews.title: Kit incomplete-disappointing
customer_reviews.text: No calibration fluid provided, had to order on my on
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Steele

product_meta.title: Brix Refractometer for Homebrew Beer Wort, Hobein Dual Scale Automatic Temperature Compensation 0-32% Specific Gravity Hydrometer with ATC
feature_bullets: ❤DUAL SCALE:Rapidly and precisely display the Brix (0-32%) and Specific Gravity (1.000-1.130) at the same time, no need to switch unit for readings each time!

❤ACCURATE READINGS WITH ATC: Hand Held Brewing Refractometerr with Automatic Temperature Compensation(ATC), the brix refractometer will account for changes in ambient temperature and automatically compensate accordingly to Provides accurate and repeatable measurements on easy to read scale.

❤EASY TO USE: Just take a drop or 2 of your brew on the prism and hold the refractometer to the light, then look through the eyepiece to get the reading. No lookup table needed and no waste! More accurate to measure sugars in verities of melon, fruits or juice.
❤WIDE USE: Ideal for Home Brew, Wine making, Agricultural, Gardening & Educational Purposes.Best choice for homebrew, wine making, and other purposes.

❤PORTABLE DURABLE & WARRENTY : Made with non-staining, non-corrosive and non-reactive aluminum material, light-weighted and portable, safe and durable. If you have any issue with your brix refractometer,please do not hesitate to contact us - your satisfaction is paramount!
